The term 'env' could refer to several sections in the documentation. Please choose one below, or
[search the CFEngine documentation for 'env'](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/search.html?q=env).

- [env_addresses](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_addresses)
- [env_name](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_name)
- [env_network](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_network)
- [env_cpus](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_cpus)
- [env_memory](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_memory)
- [env_disk](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_disk)
- [env_baseline](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_baseline)
- [env_spec](http://cfengine.com/docs/3.5/reference-promise-types-guest_environments.html#env_spec)
